Articles.Content:
After rovers complete their missions they are normally left on the planet or moon which they landed on.

The challenge is to safely land a rover on the Mun or Minmus, then send a 2nd spacecraft to retrieve it and land it safely on Kerbin.

Rules:

- The rover is not allowed to have rockets(or any other form of thrust) after it landed, they need to be decoupled to start the second part of the mission.

- You can use any mod and plugin.

- You can send more than 1 retrieval craft, if your plan requires it.

- The rover must land back on Kerbin, either on land or water.

- You need to post screenshots of the following:

- Rover safely landing on either the Mun or Minmus.

- Retrieval craft on the launchpad.

- Retrieval craft landing near the rover and retrieving it.

- Retrieval craft's lift off with the rover

- Landing the rover on Kerbin

Point system:

10 Landing rover safely on a moon

30 Land the retrieval craft next to the rover, under 250 meters.

50 Securing the rover on the retrieval craft.

50 Using 1 retrieval craft.

30 Land the rover on Kerbin

30 Landing near Kerbal Space center, under 500 meters.

40 Having a functional rover at the end of the mission.

40 No parachutes

There will be 2 lists if a docking system is released, for missions with and without docking.

My Progress:

1. Rover Delivery to Mun (with my anti-matter rocket)

2. Landed on the Mun, harshly. Litrak Rover.

[ATTACH=CONFIG]32855[/ATTACH][ATTACH=CONFIG]32856[/ATTACH]
